com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.servlet

Class WServlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.servlet.WServlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HelloWServlet, TestServlet

    public class WServlet
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
    This class enables hosting of wcomponents in a servlet container. To get a basic wcomponent application running in a servlet container:
    • Build your own wcomponent application from other building block wcomponents.
    • Extend WServlet, overriding the getUI(Object) method to return your wcomponent application.
    • Add your WServlet to your web.xml file.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    James Gifford, Martin Shevchenko, Yiannis Paschalidis, Jonathan Austin
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • TARGET_ID_PARAM_NAME

        public static final String TARGET_ID_PARAM_NAME
        The URL/Post variable that will identify a specific wcomponent to process the request. A request that includes this variable is called a targeted request. Targeted requests are used to return document content such as image data and PDFs. It is also used to support AJAX regions. Targeted requests are handled by the WContentHelperServlet.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • service

        protected void service(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest httpServletRequest,
           javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse httpServletResponse)
                throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                       IOException
        Service an HTTP request. The serviceInt(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse) method is called to do the actual servicing. If the serviceInt method throws an exception, it is caught and the user is shown a generic error page using the handleError(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse, Throwable) method.
        Overrides:
        service in class javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        Parameters:
        httpServletRequest - the request being processed
        httpServletResponse - the servelt response
        Throws:
        IOException - an IO exception
        javax.servlet.ServletException - a servlet exception
        See Also:
        serviceInt(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse), handleError(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse, Throwable)

      • serviceInt

        protected void serviceInt(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
              javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
                   throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                          IOException
        Service internal. This method does the real work in servicing the http request. It integrates wcomponents into a servlet environment via a servlet specific helper class.
        Parameters:
        request - the http servlet request.
        response - the http servlet response.
        Throws:
        IOException - an IO exception
        javax.servlet.ServletException - a servlet exception

      • createInterceptorChain

        public InterceptorComponent createInterceptorChain(Object nativeRequest)
        The interceptor component returned here is used to wrap the html fragment generated by the UI component.
        Parameters:
        nativeRequest - the native request being responded to
        Returns:
        the top-level interceptor in the chain.

      • getUI

        public WComponent getUI(Object httpServletRequest)
        Subclasses may override this method.

        This method will be called internally once per request/response cycle.

        It is up to the subclass to determine the life cycle of the returned component. Should the same instance be returned and shared by all sessions, or should there be a new instance per session.

        A good way to always return the same instance is to use the UIRegistry. E.g. 

         return UIRegistry.getInstance().getUI(KitchenSink.class.getName());
        Parameters:
        httpServletRequest - the servlet request being handled.
        Returns:
        the top-level WComponent for this servlet.

      • addGenericHeaders

        protected void addGenericHeaders(UIContext uic,
                     WComponent ui)
        Subclasses can override this method to add extra headers. They can do this by obtaining the top ui component's WHeaders object and adding headers to it.
        Parameters:
        uic - the current user's UIContext.
        ui - the application UI.

      • handleError

        protected void handleError(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest httpServletRequest,
               javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse httpServletResponse,
               Throwable throwable)
                    throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                           IOException
        Called if a Throwable is caught by the top-level service method. By default we display an error and terminate the session.
        Parameters:
        httpServletRequest - the http servlet request.
        httpServletResponse - the http servlet response.
        throwable - the throwable
        Throws:
        IOException - an IO exception
        javax.servlet.ServletException - a servlet exception
